trans-unit.source: Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Ambari to monitor and manage Linux-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Ambari to monitor and manage Linux-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Manage HDInsight clusters by using Ambari (preview)
trans-unit.target: Manage HDInsight clusters by using Ambari (preview)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Ambari to manage and monitor Linux-based Azure HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Ambari to manage and monitor Linux-based Azure HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Much of the information in this article applies only to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Much of the information in this article applies only to Linux-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: For Windows-based HDInsight clusters, only monitoring through the Ambari REST API is available.
trans-unit.target: For Windows-based HDInsight clusters, only monitoring through the Ambari REST API is available.

trans-unit.source: See [Monitor Windows-based Hadoop on HDInsight using the Ambari API](hdinsight-monitor-use-ambari-api.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Monitor Windows-based Hadoop on HDInsight using the Ambari API](hdinsight-monitor-use-ambari-api.md).

trans-unit.source: What is Ambari?
trans-unit.target: What is Ambari?

trans-unit.source: Apache Ambari makes Hadoop management simpler by providing an easy-to-use web UI that can be used to provision, manage, and monitor Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Apache Ambari makes Hadoop management simpler by providing an easy-to-use web UI that can be used to provision, manage, and monitor Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Developers can integrate these capabilities into their applications by using the Ambari REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: Developers can integrate these capabilities into their applications by using the Ambari REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: Ambari is provided by default with Linux-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Ambari is provided by default with Linux-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Windows-based HDInsight clusters provide monitoring functionality through the Ambari REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: Windows-based HDInsight clusters provide monitoring functionality through the Ambari REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: SSH proxy
trans-unit.target: SSH proxy

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] While Ambari for your cluster is accessible directly over the Internet, some links from the Ambari Web UI (such as to the JobTracker,) are not exposed on the internet.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] While Ambari for your cluster is accessible directly over the Internet, some links from the Ambari Web UI (such as to the JobTracker,) are not exposed on the internet.

trans-unit.source: So you will receive "server not found" errors when trying to access these features unless you use a Secure Shell (SSH) tunnel to proxy web traffic to the cluster head node.
trans-unit.target: So you will receive "server not found" errors when trying to access these features unless you use a Secure Shell (SSH) tunnel to proxy web traffic to the cluster head node.

trans-unit.source: Use the following articles to create an SSH tunnel from a port on your local machine to the cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following articles to create an SSH tunnel from a port on your local machine to the cluster:

trans-unit.source: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X - Steps on creating an SSH tunnel by using the `ssh` command.
trans-unit.target: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X - Steps on creating an SSH tunnel by using the `ssh` command.

trans-unit.source: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows - Steps on using PuTTY to create an SSH tunnel.
trans-unit.target: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows - Steps on using PuTTY to create an SSH tunnel.

trans-unit.source: Ambari web UI
trans-unit.target: Ambari web UI

trans-unit.source: The Ambari web UI is available on each Linux-based HDInsight cluster you create at **https://<clustername>.azurehdinsight.net**.
trans-unit.target: The Ambari web UI is available on each Linux-based HDInsight cluster you create at **https://<clustername>.azurehdinsight.net**.

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted to authenticate to the page twice.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted to authenticate to the page twice.

trans-unit.source: The first prompt is to authenticate to the HDInsight cluster, while the second is to authenticate to Ambari.
trans-unit.target: The first prompt is to authenticate to the HDInsight cluster, while the second is to authenticate to Ambari.

trans-unit.source: **Cluster authentication** - Use the cluster admin user name (the default is **admin**) and password.
trans-unit.target: **Cluster authentication** - Use the cluster admin user name (the default is **admin**) and password.

trans-unit.source: **Ambari authentication** - The default for both user name and password is **admin**.
trans-unit.target: **Ambari authentication** - The default for both user name and password is **admin**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have changed the password for the **admin** user, you must enter the new password.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you have changed the password for the **admin** user, you must enter the new password.

trans-unit.source: When the page opens, note the bar at the top.
trans-unit.target: When the page opens, note the bar at the top.

trans-unit.source: This contains the following information and controls:
trans-unit.target: This contains the following information and controls:

trans-unit.source: ambari-nav
trans-unit.target: ambari-nav

trans-unit.source: **Ambari logo** - Opens the dashboard, which can be used to monitor the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Ambari logo** - Opens the dashboard, which can be used to monitor the cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Cluster name # ops** - Displays the number of ongoing Ambari operations.
trans-unit.target: **Cluster name # ops** - Displays the number of ongoing Ambari operations.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the cluster name or **# ops** will display a list of background operations.
trans-unit.target: Selecting the cluster name or **# ops** will display a list of background operations.

trans-unit.source: **# alerts** - Warnings or critical alerts, if any, for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **# alerts** - Warnings or critical alerts, if any, for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Selecting this will display a list of alerts.
trans-unit.target: Selecting this will display a list of alerts.

trans-unit.source: **Dashboard** - Displays the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: **Dashboard** - Displays the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: **Services** - Information and configuration settings for the services in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Services** - Information and configuration settings for the services in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Hosts** - Information and configuration settings for the nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Hosts** - Information and configuration settings for the nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: **Alerts** - A log of information, warnings, and critical alerts.
trans-unit.target: **Alerts** - A log of information, warnings, and critical alerts.

trans-unit.source: **Admin** - Software stack/services that are installed or can be added to the cluster, service account information, and Kerberos security.
trans-unit.target: **Admin** - Software stack/services that are installed or can be added to the cluster, service account information, and Kerberos security.

trans-unit.source: **Admin button** - Ambari management, user settings, and logout.
trans-unit.target: **Admin button** - Ambari management, user settings, and logout.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring
trans-unit.target: Monitoring

trans-unit.source: Alerts
trans-unit.target: Alerts

trans-unit.source: Ambari provides many alerts, which will have one of the following as the status:
trans-unit.target: Ambari provides many alerts, which will have one of the following as the status:

trans-unit.source: OK
trans-unit.target: OK

trans-unit.source: Warning
trans-unit.target: Warning

trans-unit.source: CRITICAL
trans-unit.target: CRITICAL

trans-unit.source: UNKNOWN
trans-unit.target: UNKNOWN

trans-unit.source: Alerts other than **OK** will cause the **# alerts** entry at the top of the page to display the number of alerts.
trans-unit.target: Alerts other than **OK** will cause the **# alerts** entry at the top of the page to display the number of alerts.

trans-unit.source: Selecting this entry will display the alerts and their status.
trans-unit.target: Selecting this entry will display the alerts and their status.

trans-unit.source: Alerts are organized into several default groups, which can be viewed from the **Alerts** page.
trans-unit.target: Alerts are organized into several default groups, which can be viewed from the **Alerts** page.

trans-unit.source: alerts page
trans-unit.target: alerts page

trans-unit.source: You can manage the groups by using the **Actions** menu and selecting **Manage Alert Groups**.
trans-unit.target: You can manage the groups by using the **Actions** menu and selecting **Manage Alert Groups**.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to modify existing groups, or create new groups.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to modify existing groups, or create new groups.

trans-unit.source: manage alert groups dialog
trans-unit.target: manage alert groups dialog

trans-unit.source: You can also create alert notifications from the **Actions** menu.
trans-unit.target: You can also create alert notifications from the **Actions** menu.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to create triggers that send notifications via **EMAIL** or **SNMP** when specific alert/severity combinations occur.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to create triggers that send notifications via **EMAIL** or **SNMP** when specific alert/severity combinations occur.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can send an alert when any of the alerts in the **YARN Default** group is set to **Critical**.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can send an alert when any of the alerts in the **YARN Default** group is set to **Critical**.

trans-unit.source: Create alert dialog
trans-unit.target: Create alert dialog

trans-unit.source: Cluster
trans-unit.target: Cluster

trans-unit.source: The **Metrics** tab of the dashboard contains a series of widgets that make it easy to monitor the status of your cluster at a glance.
trans-unit.target: The **Metrics** tab of the dashboard contains a series of widgets that make it easy to monitor the status of your cluster at a glance.

trans-unit.source: Several widgets, such as **CPU Usage**, provide additional information when clicked.
trans-unit.target: Several widgets, such as **CPU Usage**, provide additional information when clicked.

trans-unit.source: dashboard with metrics
trans-unit.target: dashboard with metrics

trans-unit.source: The **Heatmaps** tab displays metrics as colored heatmaps, going from green to red.
trans-unit.target: The **Heatmaps** tab displays metrics as colored heatmaps, going from green to red.

trans-unit.source: dashboard with heatmaps
trans-unit.target: dashboard with heatmaps

trans-unit.source: For more detailed information on the nodes within the cluster, select **Hosts**, and then select the specific node you are interested in.
trans-unit.target: For more detailed information on the nodes within the cluster, select **Hosts**, and then select the specific node you are interested in.

trans-unit.source: host details
trans-unit.target: host details

trans-unit.source: Services
trans-unit.target: Services

trans-unit.source: The **Services** sidebar on the dashboard provides quick insight into the status of the services running on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The **Services** sidebar on the dashboard provides quick insight into the status of the services running on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Various icons are used to indicate status or actions that should be taken, such as a yellow recycle symbol if a service needs to be recycled.
trans-unit.target: Various icons are used to indicate status or actions that should be taken, such as a yellow recycle symbol if a service needs to be recycled.

trans-unit.source: services side-bar
trans-unit.target: services side-bar

trans-unit.source: Selecting a service will display more detailed information on the service.
trans-unit.target: Selecting a service will display more detailed information on the service.

trans-unit.source: service summary information
trans-unit.target: service summary information

trans-unit.source: Quick links
trans-unit.target: Quick links

trans-unit.source: Some services display a **Quick Links** link at the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: Some services display a **Quick Links** link at the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: This can be used to access service-specific web UIs, such as:
trans-unit.target: This can be used to access service-specific web UIs, such as:

trans-unit.source: **Job History** - MapReduce job history.
trans-unit.target: **Job History** - MapReduce job history.

trans-unit.source: **Resource Manager** - YARN ResourceManager UI.
trans-unit.target: **Resource Manager** - YARN ResourceManager UI.

trans-unit.source: **NameNode** - Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) NameNode UI.
trans-unit.target: **NameNode** - Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) NameNode UI.

trans-unit.source: **Oozie Web UI** - Oozie UI.
trans-unit.target: **Oozie Web UI** - Oozie UI.

trans-unit.source: Selecting any of these links will open a new tab in your browser, which will display the selected page.
trans-unit.target: Selecting any of these links will open a new tab in your browser, which will display the selected page.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Selecting a **Quick Links** link for any service will result in a "server not found" error unless you are using a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) tunnel to proxy web traffic to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Selecting a **Quick Links** link for any service will result in a "server not found" error unless you are using a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) tunnel to proxy web traffic to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: This is because the web applications used to display this information are not exposed on the internet.
trans-unit.target: This is because the web applications used to display this information are not exposed on the internet.

trans-unit.source: For information on using an SSL tunnel with HDInsight, see one of the following:
trans-unit.target: For information on using an SSL tunnel with HDInsight, see one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X - Steps on creating an SSH tunnel by using the `ssh` command.
trans-unit.target: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X - Steps on creating an SSH tunnel by using the `ssh` command.

trans-unit.source: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows - Steps on using PuTTY to create an SSH tunnel.
trans-unit.target: Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows - Steps on using PuTTY to create an SSH tunnel.

trans-unit.source: Management
trans-unit.target: Management

trans-unit.source: Ambari users, groups, and permissions
trans-unit.target: Ambari users, groups, and permissions

trans-unit.source: Managing users, groups, and permissions should not be used during the Linux-based HDInsight preview.
trans-unit.target: Managing users, groups, and permissions should not be used during the Linux-based HDInsight preview.

trans-unit.source: Hosts
trans-unit.target: Hosts

trans-unit.source: The **Hosts** page lists all hosts in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The **Hosts** page lists all hosts in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: To manage hosts, follow these steps.
trans-unit.target: To manage hosts, follow these steps.

trans-unit.source: hosts page
trans-unit.target: hosts page

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Adding, decommissioning or recommissioning a host should not be used with HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Adding, decommissioning or recommissioning a host should not be used with HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Select the host(s) that you wish to manage.
trans-unit.target: Select the host(s) that you wish to manage.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Actions** menu to select the action that you wish to perform:
trans-unit.target: Use the **Actions** menu to select the action that you wish to perform:

trans-unit.source: **Start all components** - Start all components on the host.
trans-unit.target: **Start all components** - Start all components on the host.

trans-unit.source: **Stop all components** - Stop all components on the host.
trans-unit.target: **Stop all components** - Stop all components on the host.

trans-unit.source: **Restart all components** - Stop and start all components on the host.
trans-unit.target: **Restart all components** - Stop and start all components on the host.

trans-unit.source: **Turn on maintenance mode** - Suppresses alerts for the host.
trans-unit.target: **Turn on maintenance mode** - Suppresses alerts for the host.

trans-unit.source: This should be enabled if you are performing actions that will generate alerts, such as restarting a service that running services rely on.
trans-unit.target: This should be enabled if you are performing actions that will generate alerts, such as restarting a service that running services rely on.

trans-unit.source: **Turn off maintenance mode** - Returns the host to normal alerting.
trans-unit.target: **Turn off maintenance mode** - Returns the host to normal alerting.

trans-unit.source: **Stop** - Stops DataNode or NodeManagers on the host.
trans-unit.target: **Stop** - Stops DataNode or NodeManagers on the host.

trans-unit.source: **Start** - Starts DataNode or NodeManagers on the host.
trans-unit.target: **Start** - Starts DataNode or NodeManagers on the host.

trans-unit.source: **Restart** - Stops and starts DataNode or NodeManagers on the host.
trans-unit.target: **Restart** - Stops and starts DataNode or NodeManagers on the host.

trans-unit.source: **Decommission** - Removes a host from the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Decommission** - Removes a host from the cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Do not use this action on HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Do not use this action on HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: **Recommission** - Adds a previously decommissioned host to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Recommission** - Adds a previously decommissioned host to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Do not use this action on HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Do not use this action on HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Services
trans-unit.target: Services

trans-unit.source: From the **Dashboard** or **Services** page, use the **Actions** button at the bottom of the list of services to add new services, or to stop and start all services.
trans-unit.target: From the **Dashboard** or **Services** page, use the **Actions** button at the bottom of the list of services to add new services, or to stop and start all services.

trans-unit.source: service actions
trans-unit.target: service actions

trans-unit.source: The following are the general steps to add a service:
trans-unit.target: The following are the general steps to add a service:

trans-unit.source: From the **Dashboard** or **Services** page, use the **Actions** button and select **Add Service**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Dashboard** or **Services** page, use the **Actions** button and select **Add Service**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Add Service Wizard**, select the service to add, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Add Service Wizard**, select the service to add, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: add service
trans-unit.target: add service

trans-unit.source: Continue through the wizard, providing configuration information for the service.
trans-unit.target: Continue through the wizard, providing configuration information for the service.

trans-unit.source: Consult the documentation on the specific service you are adding for more information on configuration requirements.
trans-unit.target: Consult the documentation on the specific service you are adding for more information on configuration requirements.

trans-unit.source: From the **Review** page, you can **Print** the configuration information, or **Deploy** the service to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: From the **Review** page, you can **Print** the configuration information, or **Deploy** the service to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Once the service has been deployed, the **Install, Start and Test** page will display progress information as the service is installed and tested.
trans-unit.target: Once the service has been deployed, the **Install, Start and Test** page will display progress information as the service is installed and tested.

trans-unit.source: Once the **Status** is green, select **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Once the **Status** is green, select **Next**.

trans-unit.source: image of install, start, and test page
trans-unit.target: image of install, start, and test page

trans-unit.source: The **Summary** page displays a summary of the install process, as well as any possible actions you need to take; for example, restarting other services.
trans-unit.target: The **Summary** page displays a summary of the install process, as well as any possible actions you need to take; for example, restarting other services.

trans-unit.source: Select **Complete** to exit the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Select **Complete** to exit the wizard.

trans-unit.source: While the **Actions** button can restart all services, often you want to start, stop, or restart a specific service.
trans-unit.target: While the **Actions** button can restart all services, often you want to start, stop, or restart a specific service.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to perform actions on an individual service:
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to perform actions on an individual service:

trans-unit.source: From the **Dashboard** or **Services** page, select a service.
trans-unit.target: From the **Dashboard** or **Services** page, select a service.

trans-unit.source: From the top of the **Summary** tab, use the **Service Actions** button and select the action to take.
trans-unit.target: From the top of the **Summary** tab, use the **Service Actions** button and select the action to take.

trans-unit.source: This will restart the service on all nodes.
trans-unit.target: This will restart the service on all nodes.

trans-unit.source: service action
trans-unit.target: service action

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Restarting some services while the cluster is running may generate alerts.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Restarting some services while the cluster is running may generate alerts.

trans-unit.source: To avoid this, you can use the **Service Actions** button to enable **Maintenance mode** for the service before performing the restart.
trans-unit.target: To avoid this, you can use the **Service Actions** button to enable **Maintenance mode** for the service before performing the restart.

trans-unit.source: Once an action has been selected, the **# op** entry at the top of the page will increment to show that a background operation is occurring.
trans-unit.target: Once an action has been selected, the **# op** entry at the top of the page will increment to show that a background operation is occurring.

trans-unit.source: If configured to display, the list of background operations is displayed.
trans-unit.target: If configured to display, the list of background operations is displayed.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you enabled **Maintenance mode** for the service, remember to disable it by using the **Service Actions** button once the operation has finished.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you enabled **Maintenance mode** for the service, remember to disable it by using the **Service Actions** button once the operation has finished.

trans-unit.source: To configure a service, use the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure a service, use the following steps:

trans-unit.source: From the **Dashboard** or **Services** page, select a service.
trans-unit.target: From the **Dashboard** or **Services** page, select a service.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Configs** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Configs** tab.

trans-unit.source: The current configuration will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: The current configuration will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: A list of previous configurations is also displayed.
trans-unit.target: A list of previous configurations is also displayed.

trans-unit.source: configurations
trans-unit.target: configurations

trans-unit.source: Use the fields displayed to modify the configuration, and then select **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Use the fields displayed to modify the configuration, and then select **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Or select a previous configuration and then select **Make current** to roll back to the previous settings.
trans-unit.target: Or select a previous configuration and then select **Make current** to roll back to the previous settings.

trans-unit.source: REST API
trans-unit.target: REST API

trans-unit.source: Ambari Web relies on an underlying REST API, which you can leverage to create your own management and monitoring tools.
trans-unit.target: Ambari Web relies on an underlying REST API, which you can leverage to create your own management and monitoring tools.

trans-unit.source: While the API is relatively straightforward to use, there are some Azure specifics to be aware of:
trans-unit.target: While the API is relatively straightforward to use, there are some Azure specifics to be aware of:

trans-unit.source: **Authentication** - The cluster administrator user name (default **admin**) and password should be used to authenticate to the service.
trans-unit.target: **Authentication** - The cluster administrator user name (default **admin**) and password should be used to authenticate to the service.

trans-unit.source: **Security** - Ambari uses basic authentication, so you should always use Secure HTTP (HTTPS) when communicating with the API.
trans-unit.target: **Security** - Ambari uses basic authentication, so you should always use Secure HTTP (HTTPS) when communicating with the API.

trans-unit.source: **IP Addresses** - The address returned for hosts within a cluster are not accessible from outside the cluster, unless the cluster is a member of an Azure virtual network.
trans-unit.target: **IP Addresses** - The address returned for hosts within a cluster are not accessible from outside the cluster, unless the cluster is a member of an Azure virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Then the IP address will be accessible by other members of the virtual network, but not from outside the network.
trans-unit.target: Then the IP address will be accessible by other members of the virtual network, but not from outside the network.

trans-unit.source: **Some functionality is not enabled** - Some Ambari functionality is disabled, as it is managed by the HDInsight cloud service; for example, adding or removing hosts from the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Some functionality is not enabled** - Some Ambari functionality is disabled, as it is managed by the HDInsight cloud service; for example, adding or removing hosts from the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Other functionality may not be fully implemented during the preview of Linux-based HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Other functionality may not be fully implemented during the preview of Linux-based HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: For a complete reference of the REST API, see [Ambari API Reference V1](https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/docs/api/v1/index.md).
trans-unit.target: For a complete reference of the REST API, see [Ambari API Reference V1](https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/trunk/ambari-server/docs/api/v1/index.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
